title: What is the best music for babies to listen to in the womb? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe that babies can hear extremely well when in the womb. Seemingly they can actually pick up an accent, the mother's accent, so they can hear lots of outside noises. I don't think a baby has the cognitive ability to understand Bach or Mozart so I would guess that simple melodies would be great. Happy or sad? I think both have their place but simple would be the main thing. My Dad played Mozart for me whilst I was in utero and I'm a professional musician but I'm sure this is just coincidence.

Your voice and simple melodies. It doesn’t affect intelligence (that’s just something that classical elitists want to believe). Ask a Best Doctor: Is Music in the Womb Good? Either that or Brutal Death Metal.
